Scales

Linear scale

settings: {
  expand: 3.14, // Expand the output range. Optional.
  invert: false, // Invert the output range. Default: false. Optional.
  include: [3, 7], // Include specified numbers in the output range. Optional.
  ticks: { //  Optional.
    tight: false, //  Default: false. Optional.
    forceBounds: false, //  Default: false. Optional.
    distance: 100, // Approximate distance between each tick. Default: 100. Optional.
  },
  minorTicks: { //  Optional.
    count: 3, //  Default: 3. Optional.
  },
}

# picasso.scaleLinear(object settings, Array.<field> [fields])

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
settings object No No No
fields Array.<field> No Yes No
Returns linear No ... ...

No description

# linear.start()

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
Returns number No ... ...

Get the first value of the domain

# linear.end()

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
Returns number No ... ...

Get the last value of the domain

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
Returns number No ... ...

Get the minimum value of the domain

# linear.max()

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
Returns number No ... ...

Get the maximum value of the domain

# linear.classify(number segments)

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
segments number The number of segments No No
Returns function The instance this method was called on ... ...

Divides the domain and range into uniform segments, based on start and end value

Examples

let s = linear();
s.domain([0, 10]);
s.range([0, 1]);
s.classify( 2 );
s.domain(); // [10, 5, 5, 0]
s.range(); // [0.75, 0.75, 0.25, 0.25]

# linear.norm(number d)

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
d number A domain value No No
Returns number A normalized range output given in range 0-1 ... ...

No description

Examples

const scale = scaleLinear().domain([0, 10]).range([0, 10000]);
scale.norm(5); // Returns 0.5
scale(5); // Returns 5000

scale.domain([0, 2, 10]);
scale.norm(5); // Returns 0.5

# linear.normInvert(number d)

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
d number A normalized value in range 0-1 No No
Returns number A corresponding domain value ... ...

No description

Examples

const scale = scaleLinear().domain([0, 10]).range([0, 10000]);
scale.normInvert(0.5); // Returns 5
scale.invert(5000); // Returns 5

Returns number No ... ...

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value

Generate discrete ticks

# band.pxScale(number size)

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
size number No No No
Returns band No ... ...

if required creates a new scale with a restricted range so that step size is at most maxPxStep otherwise it returns itself

Sequential color scale

# picasso.scaleSequentialColor(Object [settings, ]Array.<number> [settings.domain, ]Array.<color> [settings.range, ]Array.<field> [fields])

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
settings Object Settings for this scale. If both range and domain are specified, they have to fulfill range.length === domain.length, otherwise they will be overriden. Yes No
settings.domain Array.<number> Numeric values indicating stop limits between start and end values. Yes No
settings.range Array.<color> CSS color values indicating stop colors between start and end values. Yes No
fields Array.<field> Fields to dynamically calculate the domain extent. Yes No
Returns sequentialColor No ... ...

No description

Examples

picasso.scaleSequentialColor({
 range: ['red', '#fc6', 'green'],
 domain: [-40, 0, 100]
});

# sequentialColor(Object v)

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
v Object Object containing a 'value' property No No
Returns string The blended color ... ...

No description

Threshold color scale

# picasso.scaleThresholdColor(object [settings, ]Array.<number> [settings.domain, ]Array.<color> [settings.range, ]boolean [settings.nice, ]number [settings.min, ]number [settings.max, ]Array.<field> [fields])

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
settings object Settings for this scale. If both domain and range are specified, they have to fulfill domain.length === range.length + 1, otherwise they will be overriden. Yes No
settings.domain Array.<number> Values defining the thresholds. Yes No
settings.range Array.<color> CSS color values of the output range. Yes No
settings.nice boolean If set to true, will generate 'nice' domain values. Ignored if domain is set. Yes No
settings.min number Minimum value to generate domain extent from. Ignored if domain is set. Yes No
settings.max number Maximum value to generate domain extend from. Ignored if domain is set. Yes No
fields Array.<field> Fields to dynamically calculate the domain extent from. Ignored if min/max are set. Yes No
Returns thresholdColor No ... ...

No description

Examples

let t = threshold({
  range: ['black', 'white'],
  domain: [25,50,75],
  max: 100,
  min: 0
});
t.domain(); // [25,50,75]
t.range(); // Generates from colors and domain: ['rgb(0,0,0)','rgb(85,85,85)','rgb(170,170,170)','rgb(255,255,255)']

# thresholdColor(object v)

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
v object Object literal containing a 'value' property. No No
Returns string A CSS color from the scale's range. ... ...

No description

Categorical color scale

# picasso.scaleCategorical(Object settings, Array.<field> [fields, ]dataset [dataset])

Name(s) Type(s) Description Optional Default value
settings Object No No No
fields Array.<field> No Yes No
dataset dataset No Yes No
Returns ordinal No ... ...

An ordinal scale with the output range set to default colors, as defined by scaleCategorical.range
